byline.contributor: Andrew R. Chow contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Country music is surprisingly popular in Kenya, where local singers write and perform in style of older American stars like Don Williams and Dolly Parton; genre can be heard on several radio programs or at Nairobi bars that host live performances.
lead_paragraph: A very American genre has taken root in East Africa, with homegrown performers who idolize artists like Kenny Rogers, Dolly Parton and Don Williams.

headline.main: Country Music Finds a Home Far From Home, in Kenya
headline.print_headline: Country Music Finds a Home in Kenya

snippet: A very American genre has taken root in East Africa, with homegrown performers who idolize artists like Kenny Rogers, Dolly Parton and Don Williams.
